The Voidwatch is a fellowship of men and women come together to defend the world from extradimensional invaders called “Voidwalkers.” Driven only by an insatiable appetite for destruction, these fell horrors roam the space between dimensions, ever seeking to enter and plunge Vana'diel into chaos.${prompt}
Faced with the risk of mass invasion, Voidwatch leaders devised a strategy wherein potential threats are preemptively neutralized.
This act was made possible through the discovery of voidstones, magicked objects capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible to be summarily dispatched.${prompt}
Such efforts to stem the rise of Voidwalkers, collectively dubbed “Voidwatch Operations,” or “Ops” for short, take place in the vicinity of planar rifts--weak points in the fabric of space.${prompt}

A single person may initiate a Voidwatch operation, at which time “Voidwatcher” status will be bestowed upon all qualifying party and alliance members, allowing them to commence battle with the target Voidwalker.${prompt}

Voidwatch Ops are subject to a time limit. Exceed this limit and Voidwatcher status will be revoked for all involved, bringing the confrontation to an end. Individuals straying too far from the site of battle, too, will find themselves relieved of the status.${prompt}
Know also that those who take on the burden of the Voidwatcher become temporarily isolated and unable to receive aid from the outside world.
Such is the arduous nature of transdimensional encounters.${prompt}
Initiating a Voidwatch operation requires a voidstone, as well as a stratum abyssite attuned to a particular planar rift.${prompt}
Only one person needs to be in possession of these objects for all party and alliance members to participate.${prompt}
However, there exists a number of participation conditions that must be observed.${prompt}
When an operation commences, a single voidstone will be expended for all who possess it.
These combatants will have the opportunity to improve their spoils by manipulating spectral alignment values during battle.${prompt}
Conversely, those not possessing their own voidstone will be limited in the spoils they can obtain.${prompt}
The “voidstone” is a magicked object which, when coupled with stratum abyssite, is capable of rendering Voidwalkers visible.${prompt}
Only a single combatant need possess a voidstone to allow all party and alliance members to participate in a Voidwatch operation.
Those without one, however, will find their spoils limited in both quantity and quality.${prompt}
As a single voidstone is automatically expended when the battle commences, it is recommended that you keep stock of your inventory.${prompt}
Those wishing to obtain the stones should speak to a Voidwatch officer, who is charged with issuing a set quantity at fixed intervals.${prompt}
Stratum abyssite are dynamic stones capable of evolution. By absorbing the energies emitted by felled Voidwalkers, they become attuned with other planar rifts.${prompt}
After defeating your quarry, present your stone to an atmacite refiner--specialists in the study of otherworld geology--to have its properties determined.${prompt}
Stratum abyssite growth occurs independently of voidstones, and the latter is not required to trigger development.${prompt}

Each dimension is composed of its own existential spectrum to which objects of that world are aligned. The act of rendering a Voidwalker visible is essentially an act of aligning oneself to its existential spectrum.${prompt}

While Voidwatchers are able to, for all practical purposes, interact with such creatures, they in fact fall short of full alignment. Symptoms of this imperfect state can be observed in the limited quantity and quality of spoils normally yielded by Voidwalkers.${prompt}

Compensating measures, however, exist which allow combatants to more closely attune themselves with their extradimensional foe. One such method involves the use of alignment-enhancing artifacts known as “ascent items.”${prompt}
Alignment values raised through ascent items will remain in place until such time as a riftworn pyxis is opened at the end of a successful operation.${prompt}
Those participating in Voidwatch Ops are recommended to plan ahead in order to make effective use of ascent items.${prompt}
Alignment values can also be raised in the midst of battle by striking at enemy weaknesses, causing their existential attunement to shift to your advantage.${prompt}

Blows can be dealt with abilities such as weapon skills and magic spells, and your choice of weakness and the manner in which you strike it will determine which hue of the alignment spectrum is affected.${prompt}
The existential spectrum is comprised of five lights (blue, red, yellow, green, and white), each of which influences reward yield.${prompt}
The precise workings of each light can be reviewed when examining your current alignment values.${prompt}
Upon the successful conclusion of battle, the alignment bonus as granted by ascent items and the exploitation of enemy weaknesses are combined to determine the spoils.${prompt}

Be forewarned: Voidwalkers are highly guileful beings and will not suffer the same weakness being struck twice. Combatants must be on constant watch for any changes that may occur during the course of battle.${prompt}
Atmacite is the physical agglomeration of a monster's soul, and a vessel for its feral instincts.
By infusing atmacite to one's body using ${keyitem-article: 0[2]}, it is possible to enhance one's battle prowess.${prompt}
Be aware, however, that powers granted by atmacite can be tapped only when engaged in a Voidwatch operation.${prompt}
Atmacite is resilient and will not be expended in the infusion process.${prompt}
Furthermore, infused atmacite will remain in place until voluntarily purged.${prompt}
As the configuration of atmacite is not possible during an operation, be sure to see to your battle preparations ahead of time.${prompt}
Cruor can be used to enrich atmacite, enhancing its potency. The amount of cruor required for enrichment and the resultant properties vary with atmacite.${prompt}
Atmacite can be enriched in stages to a maximum of level ${number: 0}.${prompt}
All Voidwatchers are urged to make atmacite enrichment a priority, for they might just mean the difference between life and death.${prompt}
Periapt are lucky charms that grant myriad beneficial effects ranging from improved vitality to general upturns in fortune.${prompt}
Especially sought after are those bestowing temporary items at the commencement of an operation, granting combatants a distinct advantage against the enemy.${prompt}
Although their acquisition can only be described as arduous, the benefits make them well worth the effort.${prompt}

We've finished making the preparations for our research.${prompt}
I have been on numerous research trips, but these two are quite new to the process.${prompt}
Even when I tell them to remain calm and keep their wits about them, they don't seem to listen.
Therefore, I'd like you to keep an eye out for any trouble.${prompt}
Also, in the event we're forced to fight, try not to damage the ruins.${prompt}
Um, Mister Ghatsad!? I have a question!${prompt}
So, you want us to search these ruins and try to find something nobody's ever discovered before, right?${prompt}
That's correct. The two of you have studied the basics of the Olduum civilization, correct?${prompt}
Of course! I must've read the legend of Ramuh about a thousand times!${prompt}
The Olduum civilization was a maritime nation located near the waters of the Gugru Blue several thousand years ago.${prompt}
Within the nation lived a great individual, one who created numerous items and vehicles powered by lightning.${prompt}
Thanks to those wondrous inventions, their civilization developed way beyond that of the surrounding nations.${prompt}
However, their society eventually began to decay.
I suppose you know the reason why?${prompt}
Of course you do--mercenaries know everything...${prompt}
It's because that brilliant inventor disappeared from the country.${prompt}
The sheer greatness possessed by that one individual terrified everyone else.${prompt}
I suppose they simply weren't capable of comprehending such genius.${prompt}
And without the inventor, the people were unable to understand the technology left behind either.${prompt}
That is why I believe that this individual that appears in the story is none other than Ramuul.${prompt}
He was the wielder of the Olduum staff in the story that Megomak told us about!${prompt}
That is correct. Furthermore, the mysterious stone tablets are also from the Olduum civilization.${prompt}
Therefore, I believe it is only natural to assume that the wielder of the staff and the inventor from the story are one and the same.${prompt}
I see... Ramuul sounds a lot like the name that appears in the mythology books.${prompt}
They are similar, yes, but I don't think that's what the boss is talking about.${prompt}
If my theory is correct, then the Olduum staff is capable of much more than just controlling the stone tablets.${prompt}
In fact, I believe it is the key to unlocking the mysteries of the Olduum civilization itself.${prompt}
We've got to find that staff, boss!${prompt}
Indeed we do... The sooner we find it and can study it, the better.${prompt}
We'll do our best to try and find a hint as to where the staff might be located!${prompt}
Huh? Did you see a Qiqirn lurking over there just now?${prompt}
Abda-Lurabda, stop your nonsense and let's get going already!${prompt}
Okay, let's get started. Keep an eye out for any potential trouble, ${name-player}.${prompt}
I've got to stay calm and not freak out...${prompt}
Although, what's really terrifying is that look Mister Ghatsad sometimes gets in his eyes...${prompt}
I wonder if it's because he never gets any sleep.
Now I'm really starting to get worried.
Mister Ghatsad can be as scary as they come.${prompt}
<Sigh> I would like to see the Olduum civilization at the height of its glory, if only once...${prompt}
No! As a researcher, I must remain objective and not be influenced by such sentiment!${prompt}
You see, I researched this before coming here, but there are many mysterious ruins scattered throughout the world.${prompt}
I was looking for some kind of comparison.
For example, there are large white ruins throughout the Middle Lands, right?${prompt}
All of the literature states that they are from the Zilart civilization.${prompt}
They also are known for possessing functionality and various responses that still aren't fully understood to this day.${prompt}
Perhaps they are related to these items and vehicles from the Olduum civilization that are powered by lightning?${prompt}
How exciting would it be if these two mysterious civilizations were somehow related? Heheheh.${prompt}
${choice: 0}[Tateeya/Abda-Lurabda/Ghatsad] appears to have moved on. Try searching another location.${prompt}
Look. This symbol carved into the rock resembles an eye.${prompt}
Some theorize this symbol to mean someone who never sleeps.${prompt}
Which can also mean those that never die, or perhaps transcend what we know about reincarnation.${prompt}
Historically, those in power tend to try and find ways to achieve immortality once their civilization has reached a certain level of prosperity and stability.${prompt}
However, some say that the ruler of the Olduum civilization was already immortal.${prompt}
If that ruler truly was Ramuul, I wonder how he managed to discover the secret to immortality.${prompt}
That reminds me, the Immortals that appeared near the stone tablet also had some sort of eye-like marking.${prompt}
According to the Serpent Generals, the ones bearing that mark are in possession of powerful magical ability.${prompt}
I don't get that feeling from the marking on these ruins though.
It seems to be a simple engraving, and not related to our research.${prompt}
There is no one here. Perhaps you should check a different location.${prompt}
Hey, you've got a pretty good eye for detail despite being a mercenary!${prompt}
Yes indeed. I'm also curious to know what lies beyond here...${prompt}
Tateeya, see if you can climb up there.${prompt}
Sure thing, boss! I'll be right back!${prompt}
Um... Isn't that kind of dangerous?${prompt}
Gogoroon not likeee this at all!${prompt}
Oh no! It's attacking us too!${prompt}
${color-alt: 123}One or more of your party members do not meet the prerequisites for this battle.${prompt}
${color-alt: 123}One or more of your party members are not in the appropriate staging zone.${prompt}
${color-alt: 123}One or more of your party members are currently viewing a cutscene.${prompt}
Yes, now I remember. It was when the Empress was attacked...${prompt}
Huh!? These Qiqirn are enemies of Her Majesty!?
Heeey! We dooon't know anything about that!${prompt}
Yeah, yeah. You mistakeee us for ooother Qiqirn! Yes?${prompt}
That aside, what was that thing?${prompt}
Sooo we came here to look!${prompt}
That was a marolith. It proootects Olduum!${prompt}
Oh! I never knew that monster possessed such a function!${prompt}
Maroliths are a mooonster created by Ramuul!${prompt}
I was just thinking of that exact possibility!${prompt}
Very well, but tell me this...
Do you know anything about the Olduum staff?${prompt}
Hmm... I guess I can't say we dooon't know anything about it!${prompt}
If we had the staff, the marolith wooouldn't attack Wawaroon!${prompt}
Still... The Olduum staff is veeery scary.${prompt}
The eye mooonsters attack you if you have the staff!${prompt}
Could that be a reference to the Immortals that appeared at the stone tablet?${prompt}
Although, if they say the wielder of the staff is attacked, then that must mean that it's happened before.${prompt}
Exactly! It's ooowned by a Mamool Ja warrior!${prompt}
Ramuul ooonce burned many Mamool Ja!${prompt}
Hating humans, he went oooff to liveee on a remote island in sadness!${prompt}
Then a yoooung Mamool Ja came, seeking revengeee.${prompt}
However, the yoooung Mamool Ja reeeceived the staff and made a promiseee to never give the staff to a human.${prompt}
So Ramuul entrusted the staff to a Mamool Ja!?${prompt}
I find such a thing hard to believe...${prompt}
Yes, it really happened, a looong, looong time ago!${prompt}
If the Mamool Ja breaks the promiseee, bad things will happen!
The staff's magic will be lost, oookay?${prompt}
No, it's not okay! I don't understand a word you just said!${prompt}
Ahahaha! It's best yooou don't understand.
People can't be trusteeed with the staff.${prompt}
Wawaroon and friends must be leeeaving now!${prompt}
There was so much more I wanted to ask them...${prompt}
I don't think I understood a word they said...${prompt}
Indeed... However, this trip has proved quite educational.${prompt}
Really!? Then that means it's a success!${prompt}
We're heading back to the workshop.
We need to consult the literature and see what else we can find.${prompt}
Hey, come pay me a visit later. I have something I want to give you.${prompt}
Return to Aht Urhgan Whitegate and speak to Abda-Lurabda.${prompt}
